newsitem.title: USA: FCOJ futures end slightly higher before holiday.
newsitem.headline: FCOJ futures end slightly higher before holiday.

text.p: NYCE frozen concentrated orange juice futures climbed over unchanged late in the session to settle firmer, having spent most of the day in negative territory.
Floor sources said players did not want to approach the four-day weekend short, as the official start of winter is fast approaching. They cited speculative and local buying.
While freezing temperatures are not likely to hit the Florida citrus belt this weekend, the start of the month of December is a psychological trigger to cover short positions, they said.
FCOJ futures will not trade Thursday and Friday because of U.S. Thanksgiving. Trade will resume Monday.
January closed 0.15 cent firmer at 97.15 cents a lb after trading from 97.30 to 95.00. Deferreds closed 0.65 to 0.35 higher.
